When the crew showed up we ordered a ton of the menu. Loaded poutine (with skirt steak/bacon), loaded tater tots (with 4505 hot dog). sliders, Woodbury burger, Dry Rub chicken wings. Everything was solid but I really liked the tots and wings. Bree our server took really good care of us and for a 2nd night open they seemed pretty steady. Im imagining the game crowds before hand must have been torture, so Im glad we caught the mellow time while the game was going on
author: Kim N.

description:
Came after the Giants game (couple blocks away).  Came quick enough to grab seats but within 30 min the whole place was full of standing people.  Beers are reasonably priced and seems to have good enough selection.  Tater tots came with some delicious mustard-like sauce that was pretty good.  Good vibe.

Would come again if in the area.
author: Jason C.

description:
They have some good specials, good food. 
But waitresses seemed giving us pressure and felt uncomfortable.
author: May Y.

description:
Fantastic bar with an even better bartender. We were in San Francisco for about 24 hours while on a road trip. After leaving the Giants game, we stumbled upon this place and hoped it would fulfill our wish for creative cocktails and a cool vibe. Woodbury was exactly what we hoped it would be. 

I always call myself a "beer and wine kinda girl," not because I don't like cocktails, but because I'm so damn picky about them. I don't like sweet. I don't like sour. I don't like the taste of vodka. A sour apple martini basically makes me want to puke. This is pretty much what I told the bartender, Kinson. (See, my experience was so good, I made sure to get his name before we left, knowing I had to write a review when I got home.)

Anyway, Kinson whipped me up something that was the perfect balance of fresh and spicy. I can't exactly remember what it was, but I know it had basil in it. A lot of drinks followed, each one more inventive than the last. Each person in my group had at least 2 or 3 drinks, and our bill was half of what we expected it to be. We walked out feeling like we hit the jackpot of all bars. Too bad I live in So Cal and won't be going back any time soon, but I definitely recommend it if you're in the area.
author: Shay C.

description:
What a cool place! 

Woodbury is put together pretty well. It has a rustic-like, open wood, dark saloon kind of theme, but classy; a shabby chic. The bar area was very nice with stools for each patron, but it was really the Nintendo NES and the Atari that caught the eye of my friends and I. Next to the bar they offer both of these systems and wall mounted TVs free to play. A few beers and some video games took us right back to our childhood and sparked some fun competition in Mario Cart.

Unfortunately, despite the great atmosphere, the great beer and drink selection, I have to deduct a star because of one incident. After my friend and I continuing to order drinks without providing a card or opening a tab, our other friend shows up and hands the bartender his card; all seems normal. It wasn't until about 15 minutes later, when we wanted to close out, that we're told that the card processing system is down and we need cash. The bartender admitted to knowing this since the 45 minutes we have been there. To resolve the issue, we each had to go to the adjacent building and use the ATM. While not a huge inconvenience, it could have been mentioned much sooner and avoided altogether.

I will still recommend Woodbury to friends and family in the area based on everything that is great about the place.
author: Stephen B.

description:
Cool place, weird seating that isn't comfortable, and good wings. I asked for a whiskey neat and got 5-6 fingers which was surprising and excessive. So guess order for whiskey neat for two people? I'm not complaining. : ) I doubt it'll happen again anyway. 

Service was decent. The servers were busy but did their best to help and were friendly. I'd definitely go back to try the food and see how much whiskey I get this time around..
author: Sneha P.

description:
Great new pub in the area with delicious bar bites. There's plenty of tables in a very spacious area so it's a great spot for happy hour. Their bar stools looks like unicycles!! So cool!

The chili cheese tots and the regular loaded tots were delicious! Highly recommend getting that. One thing I was surprise to find here is the Frito Pie! These are so popular in the east coast and I'm so glad I can find it in my hometown in the west coast. Frito Pie was delicious as well. Dry rub wings was blasting with flavors. 

Staff are friendly and they have a host for your table so don't worry about having to go to the bar to order. Tables are first come first serve; help yourself.
author: Nancy N.

description: This place rocks! Great staff, good food, and a really fun environment. You can get pretty silly here, so long as it is in the name of fun and isn't bothering anyone.
author: Zachary T.

description: The staff can be rude and very hypersensitive to the ballgame crowd.  Their hours are a little frustrating in that they are only open on Sundays when Giants games are in town and have what I would consider limited hours on other days, compared to other bars in the neighborhood.
author: David L.

description: Friendly, knowledgeable staff, great drinks, and delicious food! Stopped in here when in San Francisco on business and decided on a little pleasure mixed in. The Woodbury delivers on the experience.
author: Hugh M.

description:
This is a great new bar that just opened up in the soma. It has come great drink combinations for very reasonable prices. The bartenders are wonderful, and there is a good selection of liquor thats able to satisfy everybody. There is also a lot of space to sit or stand. 
I've been here about 3 times, and I was always very impressed. Keep it goin' guys!
author: Sami B.

description: Awesome stools - 5 stars.  No stout - zip, zero, zilch stars.   When I sat down I was greeted and told that they don't open for another 15 minutes.  It was 4:45pm.  I guess I am not in Sacto anymore where even the liquor stores have "happy hour".  So, he was kind enough to let me watch tv and use the restroom until they opened.  I asked for a stout and ended up with an Anchor IPA.  The menu looked good, but I can't share a review on that because I only came here for the beer.  I am sure this place is rockin' after a baseball game because of its location.  I am a cyclist and totally love the bar stools!
author: Wendie R.

description: This place is awesome! I love the people and cocktails menu upstairs at alchemist. Always has a fun crowd.
author: Victor F.

description: Yessss they really have old school video games like Street Fighter!  And Poutine?  Sort of.  Instead of cheese curds they serve it with Ricotta cheese.  OK.  But what really made it money was getting it "loaded" which added skirt steak (YUMMMM the seasoning!!) and some bacon (just OK).  They also had Black Butte on tap which is one of the best dark beers ever.  And a mini (7 oz!) Pacifico which is almost too cute for words.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I organize my company's happy hours and we LOVE this place. This place is so stunning. Great location, within walking distance to the Caltrain station and ATT park. Full bar with excellent beer menu. The bites are scrumptious: my favorites were the mini burgers, and the faux vegan sushi roll. Also, we got to compete against each other playing old-school video games for free! How awesome is that?! 

Service is outstanding too. The managers always make sure to stop by your table and make sure you are enjoying yourself. 

This is a great stop. We will be coming back frequently.
author: Melissa D.

description:
So my main gripe here is that the bartender never returned my credit card. Yes it is my fault for forgetting to get my credit card, but the bartender just assumed that I was going to keep a tab and never asked me (I have a bad short-term memory and usually always never keep a tab for fear of forgetting my card). 

Other than that...the place seems to be a nice chill place to grab a few drinks and see some old (new) friends. However, the music was way too loud for a bar...there was no dance floor...so it might be wise to lower the music so people can actually hear each other.

I wasn't sure if there was a special or not, but I got charged $8 for just a blue moon. Pretty pricey for just a beer.

I did have a good time as I saw a bunch of old friends. But I'm not sure if I would come back given the aforementioned.
author: David W.

description:
3.7 stars for me. 

I went to meet a friend here who had just returned from Mt. Everest. It was great to catch up with her. 

Since there wasn't a Giants game it wasn't packed, but it wasn't empty either. Perfect spot to gather with co workers or enjoy a beer. I would check to make sure there isn't a game before heading here. (Unless of course, you are looking for a close spot to the stadium to have a beer before YOU are going to a game)

I had the wheat rascal, which I enjoyed, not too sweet. Service was excellent. 

The food looked delicious for what it was. My party ordered the tater tots and the sliders. I had one tot which was delicious. The menu was good, prices seemed reasonable. My only problem was that there was no option to order something healthy.  A side of broccoli would have been great, a soup? Small salad? Asparagus? Sautéed Brussel Sprouts? All of these would be a compliment to the other food already on the menu. 

I would go back, especially if I was with a party who wanted to order beer and fancy bar food.
author: Danielle V.

description: This bar is dope! We left the bar upstairs and walked into Woodbury and felt like this is where we belonged all along! They were playing gangsta rap, had TVs with sports on, TVs with video games on, and the vibe was on point. Great drinks like the bar upstairs but a more lively surrounding. I'll definitely be back to try their food items and to kick it again and again.
author: Joe N.

description:
Woodbury is a great neighborhood bar to visit, great staff, very homey, great place to go after a game, oh and love the cocktails!

Andrea W.
author: Andrea W.

description:
A great addition to the ballpark area. Wings were really great and enjoyed the drinks. Wish I could remember which ones. . .  Our server, Brie, was really top notch. 

The atmosphere is casual and very cool. The moose on the wall is a nice touch. 

I'll be brining my team back again soon.
author: Marc R.

description: I like the ambance of this SOMA bar. A great, big space with strong drinks. Came here both before and after a Giants game on a Tuesday and it never got too packed to be enjoyable.
author: Emma W.

description: Bartender was unfriendly and we paid $70 for straight lemon jiuce kamikaze. Will not be returning.
author: Robin K.

description:
This place is super close to home, we have been here a few times! Bar-tending and wait staff are awesome and super friendly. Always suggesting drinks and making creative new ones. Taste the watermelon pepper shooter it's amazing! Not sure what's it's called. But it's awesome!! 

Food and ambiance is good, defiantly bar food. Tater tots are great.

Beware on giants game days! It gets pretty packed :-)
author: Nichole P.

description:
8 dollars for black label and a beer. Decent poutine, and some solid tater tots.

This place is solid. Easy area to find parking if there are no games, and if there are, its another option to pregame at!
author: Marc T.

description:
This is a new-ish bar, located where Root Thai used to be (very briefly, not sure what happened).  I've been here twice now for happy hour since we live nearby and have really liked it so far.

Their drink theme is a bar and a shot - mostly separate, but also a few that are mixed.  My personal favorite is the Black Butte Porter and Ancho Reyes.  Food-wise, it's pretty good bar food.  We really like the loaded tater tots and I like the dry chicken wings (my girlfriend prefers saucy wings).  The prices a bit high and the happy hour deals aren't anything special, but it's SOMA so we're used to it.
author: T.J. H.

description: The bar is 50% full, I sit down. 3 bar staff, none cleaning none taking orders, mostly disengaged. Finally get a drink. Poor local bar.
author: Glenn S.

description:
Went there for the first time for happy hour with mom and sister.  My sister beat us there by almost an hour, and said the place was awesome when we arrived.  We were greeted by a nice enough bartender.  I saw Dogfish head 90 minute IPA and excitedly ordered.  Small mason jar, but hey, it's strong beer.  Mom didn't know what she wanted. 

 Asked bartender for Mexican coffee... He checked, they don't have coffee.  Ok fine.  Mom looked behind the bar at the "just the classics" liquor, and asked what kind of martinis he could make her.  Bartender said "well, it can have gin, or vodka, and vermouth...", not understanding.  I ordered her a cosmo.  He made a damn good one.  Mom asked "so what's the happy hour price for this?". Bartender says it's not part of happy hour.  I pointed out that we ordered a well cosmo, and well drinks are discounted.  Female bartender stepped in, easily  and confidently saying it's $2 off.  Fine, cool, whatever.  Maybe he's new...  

Mom ordered mushroom sandwich, she said it was tasty. Her salt and peppered fries were awesome.  Sister and I ordered loaded poutine.  Mushroom gravy was overseasoned with a mystery ingredient, but overall yummy.  I had a full conversation with male bartender about my desire for jalapenos, and after confirming he had some, they never came.   Sister also ordered the bratwurst sausage, which she was looking forward to, but never came.  Isok, half order of poutine was enough food after all.  Food was good, little overpriced for what we got, and no happy hour food specials like we had hoped for.  

Sister and I agreed to go back a little later next time, as it started to fill up as we were leaving, and just drink beer, eat fries, and be open to the scene.
author: Katie H.

description: awesome place for a drink and some grub. They have the best grilled cheese, honest. Only thing they are City prices. :)  The beer come in small glasses but if your in for a drink watch a little tv and lounge, its a must stop by
author: Ray R.

description: Great food and decor wish they would have changed the playlist. They had the same playlist as the last time I was there. Great that they had no cover on a Saturday very casual no dress code.
author: Karla R.

description: Woodbury is the place to go before a game! I was there right before HH ended and we were able to order two rounds of drinks before 7. There was a pop up BBQ event going on so I was unable to try the tots that people have been raving about, but the food was good nonetheless. We had brisket and chicken tacos, shells and cheese, baked beans, cornbread.. all amazing. After the game we noticed the line was ridic but I would def return anytime I am back in the city for a Giants game!
author: Tina K.

description:
Casey U. muses on the formula to make a new bar in San Francisco sucessful:

A new, popular bar should focus on fancy-ass liquor, and pour beer for a dollar or two more than anywhere else. It should have black butte porter for seven dollars, and P.B.R. for four bucks, and bad wine, but it should be alright because they're served in mason jars. It should have poutine on the menu, and tater tots, and a burger for over 15 dollars. The poutine should be mediocre, with sad wilted fries, sad, flavorless gravy, and an artesinal cheese which does not resemble the classic curd in any way, shape, or form (which is a travesty guaranteed to offend any self-respecting Montrealer). The bar should have a SNES in the corner with Mario Kart and Super Mario Brothers for children of the nineties with too much disposable income to get their daily bath of nostalgia while indulging in their long-repressed competitive impulses. A hip bar should have meats with a pedigree, and menus printed on high-quality paper that looks like its been through a war.

Walking in to this hypothetical bar, you should feel unworthy if you make less than 75k a year. The clientele should range from 21-35 (in this town, if you're any older, you're finished), and everyone should have full heads of hair. There should be conspicuous displays of taxidermy (which means the bar is edgy), and strange chairs, possibly in the shape of unicycles (which means the bar is unique), and bartenders in ball-caps (which means that the bar is cool). It should be a place in a formerly bad part of town where you feel great taking profile pictures, and using your new selfie-pole (which I just found out is not a euphemism for a beef bayonet...if you know what I mean), and Instagramming your night for the world to see. It is a place of style, rather then substance.

Well, hello Woodbury. It seems I've accidentally described you, right down to the tragic Poutine. You do the generic new bar thing well, but, to my untrained, impoverished, and unhip eyes, you're a totally unremarkable place.
author: Casey U.

description: Solid spot for post game food & drinks. We snagged a table and grabbed apme yummy appetizers. They have a cool list of beers and shot specials. Staff was super friendly. Thrilled to find a cool spot that isn't a total mess after the game.
author: Victoria O.

description: I'd passed by this bar multiple times on my walk to AT&T Park, but never stopped in.  Glad I finally did the other day because I was pleasantly surprised with the setup and the service.  The decor was enjoyable - cute, trendy, rustic, and clean.  The highlight of this bar experience was by far the fact that they have a Super Nintendo and Sega set up for customers to play.  Drinks prices are about what you'd expect in proximity to the ballpark, but they do have daily and ballgame specials that aren't half bad.  Worth checking out!
author: Kristen F.

description: What a nice place to find! Great bartenders who care and want to deliver;the food was amazing :) will differently be back! Had lupia and chicken wings yummy
author: amanda f.

description: Service was great. Food amazing. I think the cheddar burger is the best burger that I've ever had.
author: Shar C.

description:
I was there, I guess day 3? No usual opening hiccups, for me and my friends.  Nothing but great beer, great food , great whiskey and unbelievably friendly service. 
We had about 3 different servers at various times and all of them were incredibly gracious and friendly, without being fake. Will definitely be going back on a regular basis, just need a payday first. :-)
author: Coco F.

description: I dreaded picking a sports bar for Super Bowl Sunday, but one of my party suggested Woodbury and I'm glad she did! Despite how popular this place clearly is, especially during the big game, the staff was amazing.  I believe our server's name was Kinson(?), but man he was on top of things. We had the tots, the fries, and the wings (plus more beer/shots than I'd like to disclose), and everything was awesome. Big tv's all over the place, and video game stations to the right of the bar. Pretty typical food and beverage choices, but what set apart Woodbury for me was the staff. I'd recommend this place for any big game, and I'll be back soon!
author: Jesse G.

description: Came in very early for Giants game. I saw this new place and decided to try it out. Awesome service and fantastic food! Sorry Momos.... I've found a new spot before games !
author: Ed H.

description: This place is dope. They have a pretty good selection of beers on tap. I've only been once but I'm guessing their beer menu changes. The food is a tad over priced for the portions but was very tasty. I'll definitely be coming back here. Wasn't too packed during a play off sharks game which was a plus.
author: William M.

description: Me and a friend were on our way to SF giants game and came across this little gem! Honestly it was the 6$ mimosa sign they had that steered me right in! lol! So both of us ordered the mimosa's which were poured into a slender mason jar! pretty neat and strong ;p ! and then ordered the breakfast...we got the basic eggs, bacon,and all that other jazz. I was definitely admiring the moose heads and shot bar near the back...it kinda gave me a feel of a game of thrones bar...lol..I immediately thought of king baratheon...anyway I can see how this place may be popular since AT&T park is 2blocks away...the only thing I wish this joint had, is bigger flat screens, if your sitting directly across from the bar, the TV is not big enough to see score and the game too much...I found myself squinting...anyway I see myself stopping by again no doubt..but mainly for drinks and the shot bar next round!
author: Sarah H.

description: I really wanted this place to be great because I live a block away. Cool location and decor (like the bike tile/pedals stools). But the margarita drink of the day was really sweet with no salt option. The food was all bland and dry(!), especially for what should be flavorful, indulgent bar food: jalapeño cornbread (with weird cheese whiz butter), poutine fully loaded (with stouffers-box tasting gravy) and trio of sliders (one of them is literally bacon and bun, not in a good way)...unfortunate.
author: Emily H.

description: Crafty beers and decent apps. Good place to grab a drink with some friends. Bonus points for some old school video games in the back!
author: Lauren P.

description: 4 stars is for the food and service. The crowd and atmosphere I give 3 stars. I thought the place would be more spacious and the crowd would be older and uh not all start-up kids and older startup people ha. The food was really good, I said to a friend this taste like it's Asian inspired good...then all these Asian young chefs started coming out from the back, I was right! The tator tots with hotdogs and fish flakes were heaven! My friend loved the spiced wings, I thought they were ok, it was alot of white pepper and salt. I could pass of the Cuban sandwich, It really just tasted like a pressed ham sandwich, boring.  It needed Pickles to cut the rich meat taste. Beet salad, I've never had beets that were crunchy before, was it done on purpose?, it was still tasty.
author: Karen T.

description: Alchemist was getting really stuffy (literally and figuratively), so we moved downstairs to Woodbury.  It's much better ventilated, more spacious, and much more chill downstairs.  They also had some pretty good tater tots and mushroom poutine fries, which are awesome right around midnight.
author: Marilyn H.

description: Another great new bar! This place used to be a Thai restaurant but clearly, it wasn't doing well. Now that the owners of Alchemist took it over up stairs, they turned it into an awesome new bar with great bar food and wait for it.... SNES and Atari video games! The vibe of this place is a lot more laid back and has ESPN on which is always nice if you ask me. They have two full bars and the place is pretty spacious with plenty of seating. I highly recommend coming here for HH or before a giants game.
author: edward k.

description: Came here after a giants game, many others had the same idea.  Fun little bar with awkward metal stools and cool vintage video games.  I didn't drink but my boyfriend had an old fashion and seemed to enjoy it.  I didn't interact with much of the staff but they definitely looked like they were hustling to make drinks and keep everything clean.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Stopped in here on July 3rd right about happy hour- with a holiday - it's almost like a Friday night. The atmosphere was good, nice decor - I love bench seating across the back of the bar. It was full, but not too crowded and we were able to find a seat. Like most bars these days the design looks snazzy, but also makes for a loud venue if trying to talk - but I figure that's expected.  They were out of the mushroom burger which made me sad, but I got the salad with the savory almonds & poached egg - a poached egg makes everything more awesome.  My guy had the basic cheese burger and it was tasty - the fries - of which I stole TWO were good - crispy but not skinny. I was a fan.  Our friend had the spicy brat which she said was delicious too. We also had beer and cocktails - I love a Paloma (tequila and grapefruit) - Everything was good and fresh - some reviews say it's pricy, but it seems pretty normal for SF to me. The standout was our service. Jamie M (I think) was super nice and attentive -offering suggestions and keeping the water and the cocktails flowing.   

Oh and while it was full at 5-6-7pm - by 8-9-10 it wasn't very full - maybe that's the holiday and no game, but it was totally chill and the guy girl ratio was most certainly in favor of the ladies. 

We will be back - thanks for a nice easy fun evening out.
author: Laura M.

description: Super fun place. Special shout out to Rah and Victoria (was that her name? I remember her name being all queen-ish). Rah was super chill. Victoria funny as she's gorgeous! Coming here again for sho
author: Ankush K.

description: I crave the POUTINE!!!  And beating everyone else here at Street Fighter 2.  I beat the owner and he had to walk out of the bar ashamed and sad.  I love this place - it's very comfortable and I will be here many more times.!  Kinson is baddass!!
author: Matt P.

description: Stopped in on a slower night, Met Kinson who was working. Made me and my friends feel like we were old friends. Had a blast and he made great drinks as well. These are the type of people that make a spot great! Grab some drinks and get nostalgic and play some mario cart
author: Tommy H.

description: Was lucky enough to attend the pre-opening party at Woodbury last night. As a perfect compliment to its sister bar, Alchemist, it fills in the gaps that you might not find upstairs... Woodbury has T.V.'s, video games, snacks, lots of beer, and a Moose head! Can't wait to go back!
author: stephani p.

description: I already had a bad experience in the past with this place due to the incompetent bouncer they hired, then on July 23rd during a MetroWize-hosted event, they not only screwed up on the drinks my party ordered, but also overcharged us. Since there was a drink special going on with MetroWize, but the bartenders still charged everyone in my party the same regular price, that's 2 strikes. And apparently not just the bouncers, but the bartenders and the event organizers are incompetent here too, DON'T COME HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE CHEATED.
author: Keoini H.

description: love the food and atmosphere. great place to watch the game and eat amazing bar food. the service is amazing and everyone is always so friendly and nice. my go to spot for a chill day/night.
author: J W.

description: Great ribs,music, and atmosphere! What more can you ask for. The portions are small but if you want nice high end bar food, this is a great place.
author: Adrian M.

description: This is a cool neighborhood bar. Really good cocktails, you can also get a beer and a shot with top shelf alcohol for $10. They also have super Mario on big screens in the back. The bar stools also have peddles - my one complaint is that they don't move so I can't work out while I'm boozing.
author: Ayele A.

description: Awesome bar, great beer+shot combos and they serve food until 1 AM. Bonus bar on the second floor but under a separate name. They're connected! 'Wood' definitely recommend with a group of friends.
author: Ana J.

description:
Finally.... a real restaurant with real food and a real atmosphere. It just goes to show you the difference between posers and professionals.

Food still needs refinement.  But it's only their 2nd day.

Atmosphere....simple and inviting. 

Staff....still needs to pay more attention.  But, again, it's only their 2nd day. 

Way better than 3rd Street Bar and Grill....and you don't have to deal with a grumpy old waitress/owner with an ego.

My favorite appetizers are the beer and shots!

This place is your local hangout just to meet, eat and have fun!
author: Karma Is Coming 4 U.

description: My favorite new local spot. Not a sports bar, though they'll have the games on tv - no audio. Not a dive, but affordable and staffed with great people, with some tasty grub.
author: Tamas G.

description: This place has Moscow mules on tap! The bartenders helped break the ice on a blind date, so we had a great time. The tots were tasty too. We will be back next week.
author: Zachary S.

description: Came her before giants game. They have nice set up of TVs which they were playing the World Cup games. Score! Super knowledgable mixologist who helped me choose a great cocktail the Passarinho. Will come back for this drink and the great service and oh did I mention they have Mario cart to play!?
author: Laurie D.

description:
I went here after the Giants game a week ago and I am glad I did!  The staff, from the servers to the bartenders are very friendly and made me and my friends feel right at home.  The cocktails were amazing and the vibe is very exciting yet laid-back.  I was impressed with the service and also with the food, which is something I am very picky about ordering from a bar type facility. 

A nice touch was also the moose on the walls however I am Canadian.  I will be back next time I am in the city!
author: Lisa C.

description: Definitely a cool place. The wings were a solid choice and the burrs are great. They have some awesome and personable people on staff too. 100% vibes
author: Ian J.

description: if you love tater tots, this is the place to go.  chili cheese tater tots was DEVINE.  shot and a beer is their specialty.  definitely recommend it.
author: Christiana L.

description: service was good. was drunk and in need of some food, this was not the place. saw a bunch of great reviews but the food lack salt or any form of seasoning.
author: Gabrielle A.

description: cool atmosphere pricey drinks poor service worthy of a 3 star rating wish they would be more attentive to the guest you have to approachnthe bar for anything you need no service at the tables avoid the loaded tots the bonita flakes are sooo fishy!
author: Casilda M.

description: a sports bar trying to be a hip cocktail bar~ the atmosphere and decor was nice, new looking, and tidy. they had a Super Nintendo and an Atari set up when I was there, which was super fun. the bar itself seemed kinda limited spirits wise, but the service was speedy, and cheerful~ the bartender remembered every drink I ordered, which was a nice personal touch. overall, maybe not a destination bar for me, but if I was wandering around that area again I might go back.
author: Iliea S.

description: Cool space.  Didn't love the cocktails.
author: Amjad S.

description: this place is... interesting.  i don't really think the people who made this bar know what they wanted to do judging from the deer/moose heads on the walls, to the beer and shot and tater tot menu, to the super nintendo and atari games in the corner. but hey i'm not complaining!  anywhere where can get a shot of whiskey, modelo, chili cheese tater tots while kicking ass in street fighter i'm down for. and it's right in soma so super close to work, i'm happy.  service is a little slow, but it's a hipster bar! it all makes sense!
author: Reyana F.

description: Chill spacious bar and drinks were decent. +1 star for the working SNES.
author: Drew L.
